meanings.definition: To cut or shape an edge at an angle
meanings.sent1: She was beveling the wood to make a slanted edge.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter is beveling the corners of the table for a smooth finish.
meanings.sent3: The beveling of the cake slices made them look like tiny rooftops.
meanings.sent4: His words were beveling the truth, making it easier to accept.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes were beveling the canvas with precision.

meanings.sent1: The mirror had a beautiful beveling that caught the light.
meanings.sent2: The beveling of the glass added a touch of elegance to the frame.
meanings.sent3: The beveling on the picture frame made it stand out on the wall.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a natural beveling that gave her face a unique charm.
meanings.sent5: The beveling on the bookshelf made it fit perfectly in the corner.

meanings.definition: The act of creating an angled edge
meanings.sent1: The beveling of the metal required precision and skill.
meanings.sent2: His expertise in beveling showed in the flawless edges of the glass.
meanings.sent3: The beveling of the paper was done with such care that it looked like art.
meanings.sent4: The beveling of the hill gave the landscape a dramatic touch.
meanings.sent5: The beveling of the fabric edges made the dress look tailored.
